item.title: If you want beef then bring the ruckus
item.description: Another top act added to the bill for the Drinktober 2021 fundraising gig! Bringing fresh C.R.E.A.M. from the dairies of Shaolin, these legendary bovine hip hop superstars ain’t nuthin to fuck wit. It’s the mighty Moo Tang Clan!

item.title: CONSUME
item.description: Aliens beware, I’m here to drink beer and kick ass - and I’ve nearly finished my beer!

item.title: Pompatus
item.description: Some people call me the Space Cowboy. Some call me the Gangster of Love But most people call me Jonny, because that’s like, my name, you know?

item.title: Horsin' Around
item.description: Hitting the gym tonight and I’ve found the perfect recovery drink. When you want to keep your workout stable, you can’t go wrong with a little extra Horse Power!

item.title: Whatever a spider can
item.description: Today I’ve just been hanging out in my cool new black Spider suit which I’m sure isn’t secretly evil or anything! Here’s hoping I don’t find myself caught up in its Dark Web.

item.title: Master of Beasts
item.description: A mighty warrior approaches for today’s Drinktober. Riding through the wilderness atop Maui, his fearsome battle hedgehog comes the mighty Beast Master. This unstoppable barbarian hero lives only for vengeance - and beer!

item.title: Pump it up a little more
item.description: Lock up your pantries! That rascally rogue Jam Master Jonny is on the loose again, roaming across town with his bicycle pump. No fruity preserve is safe from his deranged mission to Pump Up The Jam!

item.title: Yarr
item.description: Arr, it be a tough life on the seven seas, sometimes when the looting and plundering hits a quiet spell it can be hard for a cap’n to keep up with all his streaming subscriptions. If ye don’t want yer crew to mutiny on account of not being able to get Disney+ ye might have to sail the dangerous waters of the Pirate Bay…

item.title: Big Chopper
item.description: I’m taking a break from it all in my cabin in the woods, but would you believe it? The ring pulls on all the beer I brought with me have snapped off, leaving me unable to open them!! Luckily I came prepared - I just need to introduce the cans to my Axe Edge!

item.title: Even more pew!
item.description: If there’s one thing we love here at Drinktober, it’s shamelessly reusing the same prop twice and calling it a storyline :) I thought I’d finally fought off the invaders, but this last one turned out to be too much for me to handle. Now my only chance to survive is if I can Escape the Mothership!

item.title: Pew! Pew!
item.description: I’ve been overrun by Space Invaders! Luckily I’ve got my trusty laser rifle at hand but they just keep on coming, Wave After Wave.

item.title: Don't panic! At the Disco
item.description: It may be Sunday but here at Drinktober towers we’re still feeling the Saturday Night Fever. Time to bust out the shiny balls and hit the floor to some tasty beats from the Disco King!

item.title: Revelations and Carvery
item.description: Another day, more water and Heineken Zero! I also appear to have replaced vino with food considering the amount of carvery I‚Äôve put away today. I’ve had a weekend of sleep, reading and revelations being by myself and sober. Some of my closer people know this has been a bit of a mad year for me with a lot of anxiety and change, but apparently it appears that I actually quite enjoy being by myself and I don‚Äôt need anyone to meet my needs or look after me.

item.title: Born in the Moo S E
item.description: We’ve attracted some top talent for this year’s Drinktober! Book your tickets now for our epic fundraising concert, featuring top hits like “Born to Ruminate” and “Antlers in the Dark”, by the mighty, the majestic, the magnificent : Moose Springsteen!

item.title: Not yet a Cat-astrophe üêà‚Äç‚¨õ
item.description: Day 2! üí™ Fiyero (AKA Mr Fifi) is enthralled by this new beer which doesnt make mother fall over. A day of crazy pirate mini golfing was cancelled due to me a) still being sick af and b) the usual rain of the North. So instead of hitting the pub with my homies, I have scrubbed a floor, eaten lasagne with my neighbours, eaten the worlds hottest noodles (TM) and stayed off the booze!

item.title: Beers don't hit back
item.description: And we’re off! Welcome back to another month of the booze-inspired mayhem known as Drinktober. We’ve got some absolutely phenomenal stuff coming up this year so get ready to go hammer on that donate button! Kicking things off with a kung fu classic as I whip out my trusty beer-chucks and prepare to Enter the Dragon!

item.title: From Zero to Hero (ish)!
item.description: Look at that artistic photo! The colour, the style, the Asthetic! üì∏ Some of you might know this has been a bit of a mad year for me, certainly not one I was expecting, and one I have certainly hit the bar amongst other things pretty bloody hard. So this year will probably be my biggest challenge yet. Kicking it off today is this flirty little Heineken 0.0 delight, served with a bloody amazing steak sandwich at my favourite establishment The Punch Hotel.

item.title: Keep taking the pils
item.description: Droogies, boozers, strumpets and losers! Welcome once more to the booziest charity event of the year : Drinktober! It’s been a loooooong year, but we’ve made it this far and it’s time to have some fun (well, it’s time for me to have some fun. Poor Heidi gets to spend a month on the wagon while I muck about and have a laugh.) This year we’re going even bigger and even better, with more beers, sillier antics, and a bumper crop of poor-quality cosplay, so watch this space and get ready to chuck some cash in the pot and make all this nonsense worthwhile!

item.title: That's all folks
item.description: For the twelfth beer of Drinkmas, the Beerman brought to me : Twelve Days original porter from Hook Norton. And so the twelve beers of Christmas comes to an end - I hope it’s been as much fun for you guys as it has for me. Don’t forget to hit the donate button on your way out!

item.title: Getting blitzed
item.description: For the eleventh beer of Drinkmas, the Beerman brought to me : Blitzen Ruby Christmas Ale from Black Sheep We’re almost at the end now, so it seems like a good time to celebrate with this famous festive special from the kebab shop - D√∂ner and Blitzen :D

item.title: Pony play
item.description: For the tenth day of Drinkmas, the Beerman brought to me : My Little Sabrony from Arbor Ales It’s been a tough old year, a bit of a ‘mare. Sometimes it’s tricky to stay stable. A little horsing around once in a while can help save you from _foal_ing apart at the seams. If you’re still reading after those dreadful horse puns, why not hoof it over to the donation page and drop a few quid in the box?

item.title: Enter the ouch mouse!
item.description: For the ninth beer of Drinkmas, the Beerman brought to me : Pricky Back Otchan from Great Newsome Brewery According to the label, the Pricky Back Otchan is the old Yorkshire name for a hedgehog, so naturally I had to bring out superstar hedgehog Princess Neville to take her turn in the spotlight.

item.title: But I'd have to charge
This is the way
item.description: For the seventh beer of Drinkmas, the Beerman brought to me : Easy Now Baby NEIPA from Bad Co. Brewing It’s the eighth day of Drinkmas - New Beer’s Eve - and I’m stretching the theme to it’s limits in a flagrant case of wanting an excuse to make a costume. Baby IPA, Baby Yoda - close enough, right! Guest starring Selwyn as the not very convincing Grogu in an undersized cardboard pod.

item.title: Meow
item.description: For the sixth beer of Drinkmas, the Beerman brought to me : Christmas Kitty vanilla porter from Brass Castle That’s right, the Christmas Kitty has come to visit - that well known festive tradition that we all know about. Or maybe it’s a deleted scene from the Cats movie? Either way - meow!

item.title: Jingle
He sees you when you're sleeping..
item.description: For the fourth beer of Drinkmas, the Beerman gave to me - Evil Elf biscuity ale, from Rudgate. He sees you when you’re sleeping He’s watching from his shelf He wants to cut you inside out So beware the Evil Elf! Yes, here to spread a little Christmas fear, it’s the evil elf. He’s off the shelf, off the chain, and out for blood.

item.title: Dej-arr vu!
item.description: For the third beer of Drinkmas, the Beerman gave to me - Anchor Christmas Ale! And so, from the Department of Shameless prop re-use, here’s a Christmas Anchor. Yo-Ho-Ho-Ho!

item.title: When elves go bad
item.description: For the second beer of Drinkmas, the Beerman gave to me, a Bad Elf dry hop ale. So it looks like I was one present short yesterday, and now I know why! I found this cheeky little character sitting on his shelf… and he’s nicked my beer! That’s what I call a Bad Elf!

item.title: Say Merry Christmas to my little friend!
Beer we go again
item.description: Well, here we are again, back between the bottle and the glue gun for a festive Drinktober special edition. When Heidi’s not engaged in alcohol free antics, she also rules over Hull LGBT+ Community Pride, AKA Pride in Hull with her tiny iron fist - or something along those lines anyway! So when she mentioned raising funds for their 2021 event I jumped at the opportunity to drink beer and show off :)

item.title: The End?
item.description: So, that’s about it for Drinktober 2020 then. I don’t know about you guys, but I’ve had a lot of fun. I’m already starting to plot next year’s antics, I’m going to have to pull out quite a few stops if I want to top this one! As always, the donation site will be open for a while yet, so if you’ve been meaning to chuck something in the pot and haven’t got around to it yet there’s still time.

item.title: IT IS DONE!!
item.description: IT üëè IS üëè DONE üëè I waited until 12 to have a prosecco…..but after 2 glasses I‚Äôm done, I don‚Äôt even want to get lashed! Possibly the weirdest DrinkTober yet, with covid and a new lockdown as of today, but I‚Äôm actually feeling quite good. This is the year I‚Äôve actually enjoyed the break and felt more comfortable to not drink. Im proud of myself and feeling quite grown up.

item.title: Don't fear the reaper
item.description: And so at last we come to the final night of Drinktober 2020. It’s Drinkowe’en - the drunkest, spookiest night of the year! I hope you’ve enjoyed my ridiculous antics all month - we’re still a long way from the target so if you’ve been thinking about making a donation now’s the time to hit that link over there, right under Heidi. As for me, I’m going to enjoy a nice quiet drink outdoors - in the Garden of Death!

item.title: Art of darkness
item.description: Yesterday’s Satanic encounter left quite an impression on me. Now that I’m in league with the forces of evil, I’ve retreated to Ye Olde Wizarding Shoppe where I’ve been dabbling in the Dart Arts.

item.title: So _CLOSE_
item.description: It‚Äôs so bloody close!! one more day to go. I was initially not looking forward to this October, but I‚Äôve surprisingly enjoyed it in a funny way. Covid times are weird, so getting out walking and away from boredom drinking In front of the telly has been great (Although no walking for me for a few days due to getting a massive tattoo on my foot Yesterday!) Overall I‚Äôm looking forward to a little drink when I finish, but I‚Äôm proud of myself.

item.title: Horny
item.description: Tonight finds me working on a “special” batch of homebrew for Drinkowe’en - this terrifying concoction was made under the influence of dark forces beyond my control. It’s not my fault - the Devil made me brew it!

item.title: Does exactly what it says on the tin
item.description: What more can I say about the ghastly skeletal presence that’s appeared to host tonight’s thrilling episode? With that massive ivory bonce, it’s pretty clear he’s a bit of a Bonehead!

item.title: Rather have a piece of toast
item.description: A terrifying presence arises as the spooky shenanigans continue. I’m being haunted by a spooky ghost - and he’s nicked my beer!

item.title: Little goody two-shoes!
item.description: What has Science wrought? The synaptic transmitter was more successful than I could have imagined, but now I’m face to face with my Evil Twin! But which one is Good Jonny, and which is Bad Jonny? Good? Bad? I’m the one with the beer!

item.title: On the rocks
item.description: I like a southern comfort or a brandy on the rocks, even a cheeky gin ting too. Yesterday I was on different rocks! Apparently when I don‚Äôt spend my sundays in the pub or cleaning, I enjoy outdoors now. Even getting muddy and climbing up waterfalls, j loved it! I‚Äôm even considering buying walking boots, what‚Äôs that all about? The none drinking has helped me go out and explore and actually move which I am enjoying.

item.title: It's alive! Alive!
item.description: The mad science continues in tonight’s instalment, as I test out my new Synaptic Transmission device. Can the machine transfer my mind and bring the construct to life? We’ll just have to wait and see…

item.title: Do you wanna get high?
item.description: Tonight I’m putting the fun back into funambulism, taking to the skies to walk the high wire!

item.title: 7 days, 7 miles
item.description: Only 7 days to go!! It feels like it‚Äôs gone super fast this year. On the theme of 7‚Äôs….. I lost another 7lbs this week, so celebrated by going for a 7 mile walk. And it RAINNNNNED. I got piss wet through, but persevered, like I have with my sober challenge!

item.title: It always brings me down
item.description: Tonight sees me back in the lab and testing out my latest invention - this handy, compact anti-gravity machine, which is definitely a brand new invention and not the dream machine with a new label hastily taped to the front! As you can see, things got away from me during the first test - my beer drifted away, torn from my hands by the Wild Gravity! It’s true what they say- gravity is a harsh mistress!

item.title: Where‚Äôs October?
item.description: Where the hell has October gone?! A week and a day to go until normality can resume. Today was manic and I didn‚Äôt atop, but I didn‚Äôt actually think about having a drink, even though I had a night to myself when I‚Äôd usually treat myself. That‚Äôs personal growth right there lads! We‚Äôve not had many donations this year, despite Johnny making it the highest class DrinkTober yet. So thank you to those that have donated, and the rest of you get your hands in your pockets!

item.title: Kart load of ale!
item.description: It’s-a-me! Jonny-O! Tonight finds me racing on that most fiendish of tracks - the Rainbow Road. Luckily I’ve got a good supply of IPA power-ups to help fend off the roaming Goombas!

item.title: Dark Passenger
item.description: There are a lot of names for what I do. Monster. Maniac. Serial killer. All I know is, if you find yourself strapped to my table, the world would be a better place without you. So what does that make me? Am I an avenging angel? The hero this city deserves? Or just another American Psycho?

item.title: Smokin'
item.description: Some smoked beer really demands some smoked food to go with it, so I fired up the BBQ in the midst of October in East Yorkshire (hey, it wasn’t raining! perfect weather!) with some homemade sausage and a chicken. Very tasty it was too!

item.title: Pub ahoy!
item.description: The ultimate challenge has occurred: had a meeting in the pub tonight after work. But, I stayed strong; and had 2 diet cokes! Which weirdly are more expensive than a pint, but hey ho still cheaper than moet. I also resisted fish and chips, my only greater love than wine, so I‚Äôm chuffed I managed that despite being up at 6 with my dad been taken to a&e and work all day.

item.title: So tired. So sober.
item.description: Sooooooo tired and I have no energy! Went to give blood Today and it‚Äôs the first time it‚Äôs not been a great excuse to get drunk quicker! Overall I‚Äôm feeling better not drinking but I‚Äôm struggling to stay awake tonight: I reckon one vodka would currently knock me out anyway so I guess Viva le Sober! Also on the subject of unconventional tattoos…. I‚Äôve booked one with all the money I saved not drinking üòÇ

item.title: Stabby Stabby
item.description: What better way to celebrate the best Drinktober yet than with some commemorative body art? I’m starting to think maybe the “Ink and Dagger Tattoo Parlour” might not have been the best choice though…

item.title: Aren't you a little drunk for a Stromtrooper?
item.description: A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far away… I had a beer. Tonight’s thrilling drinktober instalment sees me transported far across the galaxy and recruited into the Imperial legions.

item.title: I am a machine
item.description: Hola! Works been stressful and last night I struggled a lot to not drink. Butttttt, today I got weighed and I‚Äôve lost 6lbs, taking my total to 16lbs which made me feel better! Went walking and managed 8.2 miles today, meaning I don‚Äôt fancy a drink at all tonight! Please take a moment to donate if you can, my legs might drop off from today‚Äôs wandering so a cheeky fiver whilst I‚Äôm infirm would be üëå

item.title: Goblin it all up
item.description: See the little goblin, see his little feet! And his little nosey-wose, isn’t the goblin sweet? Yes! The little goblin drinking song A creepy figure tends to his hoard for tonight’s installment of Drinktober. Beware all you who would seek the Hobgoblin Gold, for you may find great riches but you will never escape the curse of the Wych Wood!

item.title: Tetris Terrors!
item.description: Back to the antics and facing almost certain doom tonight. I’ve arranged all these glowing blocks into a neat pattern, and for my troubles I’m about to be crushed under this giant beer! I guess that’ll teach me to try to Tessellate…

item.title: Please God give me a gin.
item.description: Jesus Christ I wanted a drink tonight!! I could on practically taste it. I spent a moment gazing at the prosecco at my corner shop waving my bank card and probably looked a bit not ok. Frustrating day of stupid Expensive internet Dropping out and losing my work, followed by a 2 hour rowing with a smart plug which wouldn‚Äôt work and I would probably kill your nan for a drink about now.

item.title: Where the grass is green
item.description: Bit of a quiet one for the 15th of Drinktober. Tonight I’m enjoying a can of Paradise City from Tiny Rebel :)

item.title: Sweet dreams are made of beer
item.description: Who am I to disagree? I’ve been hard at work in my secret lab working on this latest invention. Now, by harnessing the power of SCIENCE!!! my Dream Machine allows me to see inside my dreams. The results are… well, somewhat predictable.

item.title: Well Jesus Christ
item.description: Well, that was a few days. Sent to work from home because I‚Äôve developed a bizarre hives like rash type affair EVERYWHERE….. which apparently is a covid sign. Also, I‚Äôve developed random sporadic vomiting today, WITHOUT EVEN HAVING AN ALCOHOL. Wtf?!! So I am currently very itchy, a bit nauseous, and with a headache from 11 and a half hours on zoom meeting, and a little drink would be bloody fantastic.

item.title: What's better than some beer?
item.description: More beer more beer more beer more! Drink! Drink! Drink! Till you drink no more! Ravenage - More beer Almost 2 weeks into Drinktober and it’s been quite a ride so far. As you can see, all this beer is starting to take it’s toll, so there’s only one thing that can fix it… MORE BEER!

item.title: Wilmaaaaaaaaa!
item.description: Another trip back in time for the 12th of Drinktober. It’s clocking-off time in Bedrock so I’m sliding down the back of my dinosaur ready to head home. Yabbadabbadoo!

item.title: Zzzzz
item.description: Day counts on fingers 12, almost 13!! And I‚Äôm surprisingly ok, barring the odd ‚Äúoh I could have a glass of….never mind‚Äù thoughts I‚Äôm alright! I‚Äôm tired, but less tired than usual. This is the first year I‚Äôve not been tearing my hair out by week 2, I‚Äôm shocked how well I‚Äôm doing!? Someone have a party and tempt me to make it harder, I‚Äôm sick of grouting things!

item.title: For those about to drink
item.description: ‘Cause I shoot to thrill, and I’m ready to kill I can’t get enough, I can’t get my fill I shoot to thrill, play to kill Yeah, pull the trigger AC/DC - Shoot to Thrill Tonight I’m crashing the stage with rock legends AC/DC to fire my Big Gun.

item.title: Do you like movies about gladiators?
item.description: My name is Citrus Maxima. Commander of the armies of the Hops. General of the zesty Legions, loyal servant of the brew Emperor. Drinker of a finished pint, holder of an empty glass. And I will have my beer, in this pub or the next! Stepping back in time for the 10th of Drinktober, to the days of Ancient Rome, where the mighty gladiator Citrus Maxima conquered the arena and toppled an empire.

item.title: Never walked in my life unless it‚Äôs to the pub
item.description: I am back! Didn‚Äôt post yesterday because I managed to lock myself out of the website: something that‚Äôs a common occurrence when drunk but I‚Äôm not sure how I managed it sober. 10 whole days in and I‚Äôve lost 10lbs which is rather nice. Can‚Äôt say I‚Äôve saved money because my house is falling down but still, I‚Äôll take it! Today as oppose to my usual leisurely walk to the pub (the extent of my normal walking) I went on an actual solo wander which ended up being quite a treck through a housing estate, a tiny forest, some nice hills and some ropey garages.

item.title: Ich habe Space Dementia
item.description: What’s that there? I don’t care Sat alone, with no cards, playing solitaire Breathe cold air, fuel’s spent yeah Ich habe space dementia Space Dementia, Evil Scarecrow I’ve been blasted into the deep space for the 9th of Drinktober, courtesy of Arbor Ales' Space Hardware. I think the isolation has sent me a bit funny - am I really seeing Neville the space hedgehog or has my mind succumbed to Space Dementia?

item.title: All cracked up
item.description: This wasn’t quite what I meant by a night on the tiles! For the 8th of Drinktober, I’ve got a nice big can of Mosaic ale.

item.title: I need you to kill me.
item.description: I really fancy a booze tbh. I‚Äôve had a bastardo of a day, I‚Äôve not stopped and I‚Äôm still on the grouting mission so everything hurts and I would put my face through a window for a little vat of wine. I could drink it in the bath when I look at my grout. send help.

item.title: All washed up
item.description: I’ve been attacked by sea monsters, and hurled into the deep by an ungrateful crew, but at last, my nautical adventure comes to a happy ending, as I’ve washed up on this Tropical island. Now to enjoy a few tasty beers among the palm trees with my little parrot buddy Iago. Cheers!

item.title: A worrying development
item.description: Today‚Äôs the first day I fancied a drink, which had led to a somewhat worrying development. To keep me occupied, I have now replaced having a relaxing glass of wine with DIY. Today we have had a light fitted, ripped down a ceiling and it‚Äôs now 11pm and I‚Äôm removing all the grout from the bathroom tiles. Is this healthy? Where will this end? Will we survive?!!!! Also my feet hurt, my hand is black And I have a significant amount of plaster in my hair and tit region.

item.title: Mutiny!
item.description: Gather round and listen to this tale of treachery upon the high seas. It seems my shipmates took offence to my language yesterday, in the middle of the night those mutinous dogs dragged me from my bunk and tossed me overboard. I managed to save myself from Davey Jones' locker by lashing a raft together from some driftwood, but now I’m a castaway, adrift upon the Big Sea.

item.title: With a what now?
item.description: Fuck! You! You’re a fucking wanker! We’re gonna punch you right in the balls! Fuck! You! With a fucking anchor! You’re all cunts so fuck you all! Alestorm - Fucked with an anchor Stretching the theme a little bit for the 5th of Drinktober, but I couldn’t resist the opportunity to combine three of my favourite things. Pirate costumes, heavy metal and gratuitous swearing! Sing along, ye scurvy dogs!

item.title: Well that was a challenge
item.description: I‚Äôve survived a challenge! Most of you people know I‚Äôm a little….. funny. I‚Äôm quite OCD and if things aren‚Äôt right or tidy, expect a breakdown. I‚Äôm also an emotional drinker: annoyed? Have a brandy. Happy? Have a champers. Stressed? Vat of wine and an absolut chaser. So yesterday I didn‚Äôt manage a post, but I did have half my kitchen ceiling down fixing a leaking lead pipe, plaster all over, half my bathroom taken out and no electric due to my dodge lighting.

item.title: It's time to get Loco!
item.description: For the 4th of Drinktober we step into the ring with the mighty El Loco - the most feared luchador in all of East Yorkshire! Undefeated in every match, this fearsome hero of the ring strikes terror into the hearts of his opponents, and loves nothing more than to celebrate a successful match with a victory beer!

item.title: Water leaks from the ceiling and you also have to drink it
item.description: Ok day three, whatcha got? Well we all know I‚Äôm a prolific stress drinker. So today I had a small paddy that my house is essentially falling down, nothing works and my pipes (Which are leaking) are made of lead (apparently this is bad). So I realllllly fancied some wine, or 9 double vodkas of something . However, I‚Äôve stayed strong and drank water all goddamn day. Which is slightly less appealing to drink when it‚Äôs slowly dripping from your ceiling.

item.title: What a lovely day!
item.description: Beer. Beer never changes. When the old world fell, only a few survived. Roaming the blacktop between the remnants of the cities, scavenging for the last remaining booze of a lost civilisation. A drop of ale in the wasteland can help keep a man sane - because if you don’t keep your head… you’re nothing but Roadkill… Things are going a little bit post-apocalyptic for the 3rd of Drinktober as I take to the roads of the blasted wasteland that was once Yorkshire in search of more beer.

item.title: Looking a little pale
item.description: A fairly quiet one for the second of Drinktober. I’m hard at work in the Beercave prepping for the insanity to come, just taking a break to enjoy a tasty Rudgate Pale. Tune in tomorrow, same beer time, same beer channel, when we start to kick things up a notch!

item.title: DAY 2!
item.description: Day 2, feeling confident! Day one was a piece of piss because I was ill, so I slept through my normal drinking time! So far today I‚Äôm on 5 coffees, a herbal tea and 4 waters, might be piddling for England but sober af! üôåüèª

item.title: Back once again with the Drunken Master
item.description: It’s the first of Drinktober, and I should be working hard on getting everything set up for this year’s shenanigans, but instead here I am just chilling in my hammock with a nice cold lager. I guess I’m just a Lazy Boy ;)

item.title: Drinktober 2020 Trailer
item.description: Here’s the official video trailer for Drinktober 2020. Enjoy!

item.title: Drinktober 2020 - Lockdown lock-in!
And that's a wrap
item.description: So there we have it, folks. Another year of #Drinktober comes to a close, and we absolutely smashed it this time around. Donations are currently sitting at 110% of the fundraising target, Heidi’s swanned off to Tenerife to drink her body weight in Prosecco, and it’s time to sign off until we come back even bigger and better for Drinktober 2020! Watch this space!

item.title: It‚Äôs only chuffing DONE!
item.description: Well, it‚Äôs done!! And what a bloody month. Here‚Äôs what I learned: I don‚Äôt need alcohol, but I DO have the most stressful life and I don‚Äôt take enough time out. The past 2 weeks at work were hard. Not having a drink made me realise my job can be emotionally draining. I have little time for myself and I take on too much without thinking about unwinding in a better way.

item.title: Day 31 - Drinkoween!
item.description: Gee, Jonny, what are we going to do tonight? Same thing we do every night - DÃÉÕ¶ÃíÕ®ÃÖÕäÕÄÕ¢ÕÖÃóÕñÕñÕìÃπÕéRÃöÕÇÃµÕèÕïÃ†ÃòIÃäÃëÕêÕÜÕßÕêÃçÃâÃΩÃ≤Ã∞ÕâNÕ≠ÃÅÕ®Õ≠ÃîÕëÃΩÕ¢Ã∂ÕûÃºÃªÃ©KÕóÃÜÕÑÕ´ÃâÃåÕÜÃ¥Ã∂Õ¢ÃºÃ∞ÕìÕìÃ≤ ÃâÕ≠ÃÇÕíÕùÕàÕàÕìÕôBÃÉÃëÕ≠ÃÄÕ™ÕØÕ™Õ¶ÃõÕûÕ¢Ã¨Ã™ÕîÃªÃñEÕãÕ©ÕÄÃ∑ÃïÃ≤ÃòÃûEÕÉÃéÕ≠ÃìÕÑÃêÃæÕ´Ãµ“âÃõÃ≠ÕôÃ©ÕçRÃéÃÅÃìÃâÕ™ÃÆÕà ÃöÕÜÃøÕ™ÕßÕåÃâÕûÕàÃ™Ã¨ÃòÕéÃ£Ã¨Ã©AÕ®ÃñÃñNÕ¨ÃÑÃÅÃêÃèÕ™Ã∏ÕâÃ∫ÕïÃ•Ã´DÕ¶Õ¨ÕÄÃ∫ÃûÃ™Ã©Õç ÕõÕãÕ•ÃçÃ®Ã°ÕàÃ≤ÕàÃ§ÃûHÃæÕÆÃÇÕúÕ†ÃªÃ™ÃÆÃ™ÃûÃπÕáÕÖAÃîÃÜÃΩÃäÕÑÃßÃ∏ÃôÃÆÃ•ÃüÃ≠ÕÖIÃâÃÑÃãÃøÕÆÕ®ÃßÕÄÃ¶ÕïÕáÕïLÕêÃÇÃìÕëÕúÕ†Ã†ÃπÃ£ÃóÃ∞ÃüÕâ ÕØÕÉÃÅÃ®Ã†ÕàÕáÃ´ÕàÃºÃóSÕ•Õ•ÃÑÕ©Õ§ÃîÃåÃ∑ÃºÕÖÃØÃ±AÕÇÕêÕ¨ÕäÃöÕ©ÕÇÕ†“âÕîÃúÕïÕîÃªÃùÕçÕñTÃíÃÜÃïÃ£Ã•AÃéÃâÕãÕ•Õ•ÃÑÕåÃëÕÉÕûÃ≠ÃûÃ£NÕ©ÃãÃêÕêÕëÕ•ÃÜÕ´Õ¢ÕúÃòÃÆÃ±ÃñÃñÃ™ÃùÕöÃØ!Õ¶ÃÅÃãÃæ“âÃ¥Õì We’ve reached once again, the final night of #Drinktober -Drinkowe’en is here! Seemed only right to see the end with the most evil beer I could lay my hands on… If you’ve enjoyed my ridiculous antics all month, why not click on the link over there -> (or down below if you’re on mobile) and donate a few bob for the real hero of Drinktober.

item.title: Day 30 - Bustin' makes me feel good
item.description: These supernatural incursions have been getting out of hand. Time to bust out my trusty proton pack for the 30th of #Drinktober and send them all back to Spookytown! Join us again tomorrow night for the final frightfest of #Drinktober 2019 - Drinkowe’en!!

item.title: Day 29 - When there's no more room in hell
item.description: The horror continues on the 29th of #Drinktober as the dead rise from their graves to walk the earth in a never-ending quest for beer. Beware, the terrors of the Graveyard Shift!

item.title: Day 28 - They'll get yours in the end!
item.description: Spooky creatures of the night seem to be everywhere on the 28th of #Drinktober - I just caught this Gangly Ghoul sneaking a snack from the fridge!

item.title: Day 27 - You remind me of the Babe
item.description: Another monstrous creature appears for the 27th of #Drinktober - emerging from his haunted skull cave comes the evil King Goblin!

item.title: Day 26 - Sky is turning red!
item.description: Frightening scenes for the 26th of #Drinktober! The season of terror begins beneath a Blood Red Sky, with the release of the nightmarish Drinkowe’en video trailer

item.title: She‚Äôs back!!
item.description: She‚Äôs back!!! Due to a short break, mainly consisting of the website not letting me log on, a bout of horrendous flu which killed me completely for a week and my job being ridiculously full on for several days which consumed my life….. I am back!! Just in time for the end to be in sight! Thank you to everyone who has donated so far, this has certainly been a journey to this point üòÇ

item.title: Day 25 - Pew! Pew!
item.description: Beer and video games - not a bad way to spend the 25th of #Drinktober! Things take a spooky turn tomorrow as we begin the countdown to Drinkowe’en

item.title: Day 24 - As long as you cleanup after
item.description: It’s the 24th of #Drinktober - just one more week to go! Tonight’s is another Loch Lomond beer - this one’s Come on Pilgrim New England IPA.

item.title: Day 23 - Night of the comet
item.description: Oh deer. Tonight’s #Drinktober offering is a Comet dry-hopped lager.

item.title: Day 22 - High Voltage
item.description: It’s a real shocker for the 22nd of #Drinktober, as we head to the Electric Cafe, probably for some electric sausage & chips.

item.title: Day 21 - Different class
item.description: 21st of #Drinktober, and tonight’s beer is a Loch Lomond Different Class.

item.title: Day 20 - We all float here
item.description: The strangest thing happened for the 20th of #Drinktober. Just a couple of sips of my beer and I found myself free from the shackles of gravity and beginning to Levitate!

item.title: Day 19 - For those about to Bock
item.description: Day 19 of #Drinktober comes to you all the way from Bocktoberfest. Prost!

item.title: Day 18 - Keep taking the Pils
item.description: Yep, Vikki was working at Erofame again last week, so I’ve got a nice drop of Gilde Pilsener for the 18th of #Drinktober, all the way from Hannover.

item.title: Day 17 - Don'cha think?
item.description: #Drinktober the 17th sees me back to normal. Tonight’s post might be a little less spectacular but it’s still pretty Iconic :)

item.title: Day 16 - SMASH!
item.description: Disaster strikes on the 16th of #Drinktober, as Gamma Ray exposure unleashes my infinite rage and I’m transformed into the Incredible Drunk Hulk, rampaging across the city in search of more beer!

item.title: Day 15 - No clever name tonight
item.description: Crystal wheat beer for the 15th of #Drinktober, with Hop Foundry’s Kristallweizen

item.title: Day 14 - Never a frown
item.description: 14th of #Drinktober and I’m just having a normal Monday, sitting around in my Golden Crown as you do.

item.title: Day 13 - We'll get there fast and then we'll take it slow
item.description: After I made it back from the depths of space, I needed a nice holiday. Here I am, relaxing in a tropical paradise with a can of Kokomo passion fruit and grapefruit pale ale :)

item.title: J2hooooooooe
item.description: Had a few days off posting due to work and personal life drama so I‚Äôm back! Enjoying the J20 life and my new favourite indulgence…. Black Forest milkshakes. Chocolate milkshake, black cherries, blend it up…. no wonder I‚Äôm not skinny despite the lack of meat!

item.title: Day 12 - Park in it, Viking!
item.description: Blasting across time and space for the 12th of #Drinktober, we find the mightiest warrior in the galaxy - the fearsome Space Viking!

item.title: Day 11 - So not the little guys from Fraggle Rock then?
item.description: I’ve had some very nice beers so far in #Drinktober, but tonight’s was a Doozie. From the excellently named By The Horns brewery \m/

item.title: Absolute vegan bullshit
item.description: Have you ever eaten a vegan sausage? I have now. It was awful. Had to spit it out, think it ruined my life. Three more weeks of this. Vegan sausage bullshit. It‚Äôs making me sad.

item.title: Day 10 - Is this about fancying the Scarlet Witch?
item.description: 10 days into #Drinktober and I’ve been overcome with Wanderlust

item.title: Beef dripping
item.description: I don‚Äôt have anything exciting to say. I‚Äôve just accepted drinking water is my life now…. made a vegan sausage casserole for tomorrow nights dinner and made very nice dumplings to chuck in. Of course housemate then reminds me that they have beef dripping in, so I can‚Äôt have them. Chuffing excellent. Fml. Over and out üôÑ

item.title: Sharks!
item.description: 9th of #Drinktober. I heard it would be a Perfect Storm - I wasn’t expecting a Sharknado!

item.title: Day 8 - Curious
item.description: Getting a little fruity for the 8th of #Drinktober with this orange infused IPA

item.title: Foam shrimp and tramps shoes.
item.description: Today I had a late meeting again, so popped to the pub for the ultimate test. I was gaggingggggg for a drink. Any drink. Wine. Gin. Terps. I fancied one. The batman (I meant barman but autocorrect knows best) recommended an Alcohol Free Kopperberg. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just like the real thing! You can‚Äôt even tell the difference!‚Äù I was assured. Not a cider drinker but I thought give it a bash.

item.title: Day 7 - Hat
item.description: Going cowboy style for the 7th of #Drinktober with this Wild Bill’s IPA.

item.title: Day 6 - HONK!
item.description: For the 6th of #Drinktober, I thought I’d have a nice quite drink in the village. Unluckily for me, my plans were disrupted by the arrival of this Mad Goose!

item.title: Vegetarianism is just a big Miss-Steak
item.description: I‚Äôve realised that this site has become more my rambling blog than anything so I‚Äôll keep it brief today! 90‚Äôs Carrie Bradshaw narration isn‚Äôt a good look for me. Still alcohol free and I‚Äôve developed a new love for good old water. Managed to stay off the quorn today and had a nice Sunday dinner feat. nut roast. I have however replaced my wine habit with a spending habit: I‚Äôve bought a painting, another lamp, a hat, a magnetic eyelash set, a kaftan, a pigeon pin badge and a gift for the missus already this weekend (the last ones a secret.

item.title: Day 5 - Du Hast Bier
item.description: You’ve got a pussy! I have a dick-ah! So what’s the problem? Let’s do it quiiiiick Pulling out all the stops for the 5th of #Drinktober, for this Rammsteiner Pilsner I actually went on tour with Rammstein and they let me ride their giant cock cannon, as you can see in the totally real and definitely not at all photoshopped picture below.

item.title: Habit is a funny thing
item.description: Habits are funny aren‚Äôt they! 5 days in and I‚Äôve lost count of the number of times I‚Äôve thought ‚Äúoh I‚Äôll just grab a coke‚Äù or wandered aimlessly to the wine aisle and spent ¬£15 before I‚Äôve even thought about if I actually want it! Today was chilled with the wife and I‚Äôve smashed in a decent homemade Quorn Lasagne. I now own 48% shares in Quorn FYI. My skin is also looking much brighter, although I do smash a load of acid on my face every night because 30‚Äôs, so it could also be that.

item.title: Day 4 - Friday Night Fever
item.description: #Drinktober the 4th and I hit the dance floor to show off my moves with this Disco Forklift Truck. (The forklift’s parked outside, obviously)

item.title: Get your Friday Heidi on
item.description: Today is slightly better! Purchased some iron tablets: turned out that‚Äôs what fucked me up yesterday. An iron tablet and a multivit and I‚Äôm off. I went out for work drinks this evening and had (drum roll please!) a J20 and a virgin cocktail…. Which was nice but called ‚Äòthe love island‚Äô so minus 3 points. I also spent a hideous amount on experimental quorn and nutroasts in Lidl. I‚Äôm currently sipping cranberry juice out of a wine glass so I can express my inner Friday Heidi.

item.title: Day 3 - Twisted
item.description: For the 3rd of #Drinktober, a poorly executed tribute to the late Keith Flint as I become the twisted FireCatcher!

item.title: FML give me a kebab
item.description: Well today has kicked my arse. I‚Äôve felt absolutely crap all day: not sure if it‚Äôs lack of meat or caffeine. Shit day, sat in a meeting until 10.30 surrounded by wine and burgers…. kill me now. I also had my first Ribena. What a load of shit.

item.title: Day 2 - 5 miles off the ground
item.description: When we shoot to kill And you know we always will It’s a bomber! It’s a bomber! A Lancaster bomber - for the 2nd of #Drinktober I’ve got this rather tasty amber ale, even if it is named for the dark lands on the Wrong side of the Pennines…

item.title: Day 1.5 - Meanwhile on Planet Heidi
item.description: kill me now

item.title: Day 1 - Dirt Cheap
item.description: Contracts… Neckties! HIGH VOLTAGE!!! #Drinktober 2019 kicks into action with some Dirty Deeds

item.title: Drinktober 2019
item.description: Drinktober It‚Äôs all about raising money for a very good cause ‚Äì Macmillan Cancer Support. Macmillan provide physical, financial and emotional support to people with cancer to help them live life as fully as possible. It‚Äôs a fantastic charity and the help and support means a lot to many people. So, for the fourth year in a row, absolute leg-end superstar Heidi is going to pass on the prosecco, say nein to the wine and just giving up any and all alcohol for a gruelling 31 days.

item.title: Drinktober 2019
item.description: Donation info: Pride relies on donations to help us put on the best event we possibly can: last year our average donation was less than 1p per attendee :( You can donate by…. Paypal at: https://prideinhull.co.uk/donate/ (PayPal donation address is heidi@prideinhull.co.uk) Using Amazon Smile and selecting Hull LGBT+ Community Pride as your chosen charity, at no cost to you! Texting Text HULL 3 to 70085 to donate ¬£3

item.title: Day 31 - Drinkoween!
item.description: It’s the 31st of #Drinktober - #Drinkoween! So there was really no other option than to assemble a bunch of my spookiest stuff and finish off the month with the “Unofficial Beer Of Halloween” - Hobgoblin!

item.title: Day 30 - Blue moon
item.description: It’s the 30th of #Drinktober After escaping the Medusa’s petrifying gaze I thought I was safe, until the rising of the Blue Moon unleashed the beast within - transforming me into the dreaded Blue Wolfman!

item.title: Day 29 - Turned to stone
item.description: Disaster strikes for the 29th of #Drinktober - I’ve been turned into stone by the fearsome Medusa! Can I break the spell before the next exciting installment? Tune in tomorrow to find out…

item.title: Day 27 - Pumpking
item.description: A horrifying presence arises for the 27th of #Drinktober - Beware the evil of the Pumpking!

item.title: Day 28 - Ghost Ship
item.description: Shiver me timbers! Legends tell of a lost pirate vessel, cursed to wander the high seas eternally with her terrifying skeleton crew, only appearing on the 28th of #Drinktober to plunder the booty of the living. Beware the Ghost Ship, me hearties, lest she take ye to Davy Jones' locker!

item.title: Day 26 - Season of the Witch
item.description: Getting close to Halloween now, so for the rest of #Drinktober I’ll be drinking the spookiest beers I can find, starting with this Blonde Witch :)

item.title: Day 25 - Sk√•l!
item.description: A Viking theme for the 25th of #Drinktober with a mighty horn of Jorvik ale. Sk√•l!

item.title: Day 24 - Up the Irons
item.description: For the 24th of #Drinktober it’s on with the Maiden shirt and up with the horns for a lovely bottle of Trooper \m/

item.title: Day 23 - Urban Fox
item.description: Slept like crap yesterday and I’m absolutely shattered tonight, so no chance of any comical costume shenanigans:( But it’ll take more than that to stop me celebrating the 23rd of #Drinktober with this Urban Fox red ale :)

item.title: Day 22 - Proper Job
item.description: 22nd of #Drinktober - tonight I’m having a Proper Job :)

item.title: Day 21 - Rheinbacher
item.description: Getting a bit more mileage out of my awesome new beer stein for the 21st of #Drinktober with a Rheinbacher Weissbier and a German shirt I borrowed from Vikki

item.title: Day 20 - Yarr!!
item.description: Yarr! Little bit of a nautical theme for the 20th of #Drinktober - Cap’n Jonny’s relaxing after a long day on the high seas with a Shipyard IPA

item.title: Day 19 - Kingfisher
item.description: 19th of #Drinktober and it’s curry night again. This week I’m having a Kingfisher with a lamb naga mirch from the local takeaway :)

item.title: Day 18 - Arise, my mighty pink army!
item.description: It’s the 18th of #Drinktober and I’m having a pint of Joe’s Draft ale before going to see the awesome Evil Scarecrow in York \m/ Crabulon! Crabulon! Crabulon!

item.title: Day 17 - Bees!
item.description: For #Drinktober the 17th I’m having a Queen Bee honey ale. I’d be some kind of body-snatched doppelganger if I didn’t say that it’s the bee’s knees and it’s given me a bit of a buzz :)

item.title: Day 16 - Treacle Treat
item.description: We’re past the halfway mark now on the 16th of #Drinktober, and I’m having a Treacle Treat. Really nice dark ale with a cool skull design, which is always good :) How’s your water/ Heidi? :p

item.title: Day 15 - Felinfoel ESB
item.description: For the 15th of #Drinktober I’m having a Felinfoel ESB, mainly because its got an awesome dragon on the label :)

item.title: Day 14 - Dunkel Fester
item.description: It’s the 14th of #Drinktober and I’ve got a nice bottle of the excellently named Dunkel Fester :D

item.title: Day 13 - Time for pudding
item.description: 13th of #Drinktober - tonight I’m having a Sticky Toffee Pudding Ale. It’s really nice :)

item.title: Day 12 - King Cobra
item.description: 12th of #Drinktober and it’s curry night so I’m having a King Cobra. Hail to the King, baby!

item.title: Day 11 - We are the Road Crew
item.description: 11th of #Drinktober and I’m busting out an old favourite - Mot√∂rhead R√∂ad Crew \m/

item.title: Day 10 - Dark matters
item.description: 10th of #Drinktober, and tonight I’m having a Dark Matter coffee porter. Nice beer, kind of chocolatey ! :)

item.title: Day 9 - Oktoberfest
item.description: For the 9th of #Drinktober I’ve got a great big Stein of Oktoberfest Bier which Vikki brought me back from Germany last week. Prost!

item.title: Day 8 - Hot tub (but no time machine)
item.description: The 8th of #Drinktober finds me recovering from an awesome weekend of retro gaming by depeopling in the hot tub with this Beardo IPA and season 5 of Steven Universe :)

item.title: Day 7 - Guinness
item.description: Bit of a quiet one for the 7th of #Drinktober, just chilling out with a pint of Guinness after video gaming all weekend.

item.title: Day 6 - A Thirst for Justice
item.description: For the 6th of #Drinktober, Judge Beerman is quenching his thirst for justice with a pint of Wadworth IPA

item.title: Day 5 - Modelo (and a burrito)
item.description: I’m away for the weekend so starting early for the 5th of #Drinktober with a Modelo and a burrito :)

item.title: Day 4 - Hoptical Illusion
item.description: Strange and mysterious goings on for the 4th of #Drinktober. Am I really drinking this beer, or is it just a… Hoptical Illusion…

item.title: Ghost Dance
item.description: It’s the third of #Drinktober, following up last night’s cowboy beer with this Ghost Dance Chinook Pale Ale, which is rather nice and hoppy :)

item.title: Jesse James IPA
item.description: Howdy there, pardners! For the second of #Drinktober, a quick raid of Aldi’s craft beer section yielded up this cowboy-themed American Pale Ale - seemed only right to dress for the occasion

item.title: Drinktober 2018 Begins!
item.description: Right then, let’s get this show on the road shall we? #Drinktober 2018 starts off nice and easy with some Heineken that was still in the fridge from the weekend.

item.title: Day 31 - Drinkoween!
item.description: Bit of a spooky theme for the 31st of #Drinktober - it’s Drinkoween! Tonight I’m drinking Pumpking - evil pumpkin beer

item.title: Day 30 - Cuba libre
item.description: 30th of #Drinktober - only one more day to go! Cuba Libre tonight, another premixed canned job :)

item.title: Day 20 - Roadcrew
item.description: 20th of #Drinktober, tonight I’ve got a pint of Roadcrew \m/

item.title: Day 29 - Tastes like strawberries
item.description: Not long to go now! 29th of #Drinktober, tonight’s offering is a strawberry daiquiri. Learned my lesson from the Pina colada and beefed it up with a drop of Bacardi :)

item.title: Day 28 - A bit of DnB
item.description: 28th of #Drinktober, and tonight I’ve found this alcoholic dandelion & burdock. It’s not bad :)

item.title: Day 27 - Tell 'em about the honey, Mummy!
item.description: 27th of #Drinktober, tonight I had a honey Jack Daniel’s & lemonade while I was out being crafty in the garage __

item.title: Day 26 - Pimms
item.description: For the 26th of #Drinktober, I finally opened this can of Pimms with blackberry and elderflower that’s been lurking in the fridge for a couple of years now. I’m not entirely sure what Pimms is exactly, but this basically tastes like Ribena.

item.title: Day 25 - This wasn't my best idea
item.description: 25th of #Drinktober, and tonight’s theme is “wow, I’ve got a lot of tequila left. I wonder if it mixes well with this tropical fruit drink?” Narrator : It did not mix well

item.title: Day 24 - Getting caught in the rain
item.description: 24th of #Drinktober - tonight I’ve got some kind of ready-mixed pina colada I found at Sainsbury’s. Very tropical

item.title: Day 23 - Ouzo margarita
item.description: 23rd of #Drinktober - random concoction week continues with this Ouzo margarita. It kind of works :)

item.title: Day 22 - What even is this stuff?
item.description: 22nd of #Drinktober, and we’ve reached the “any old shite that’s in the house” stage ) This is from a box of pre-packaged “flavoured shots” - think this was the apple one. __

item.title: Day 21 - TVR
item.description: Back on a more normal schedule for the 21st of #Drinktober and tonight is a total student classic, the TVR.

item.title: Day 19 - Frankenstein creation
item.description: 19th of #Drinktober and I’m getting inventive tonight. I call this one the Mead-garita. Half margarita mix, half mead - it’s actually pretty good :)

item.title: Day 18 - No sleep...
item.description: 18th of #Drinktober - Brooklyn Lager tonight

item.title: Day 17 - Cactus Jack
item.description: 17th of #Drinktober, and tonight it’s Cactus Jack’s Blackjack flavour schnapps. You probably wouldn’t like this one either :)

item.title: Day 16 - Ouzo
item.description: Ouzo and lemonade tonight for the 16th of #Drinktober - we’re past the halfway mark now, how’s your resolve holding up? :)

item.title: Day 15 - Random
item.description: 15th of #Drinktober and today I’m drinking some random stuff I found at Aldi. “Aliz√©”, apparently - mix of cognac, vodka and passion fruit. I didn’t even know French vodka was a thing…

item.title: Day 14 - Scuttle left!
item.description: Alcoholic ginger beer for the 14th of #Drinktober.

item.title: Day 13 - Heineken
item.description: Out of town and such with the shockingly expensive and limited hotel bar selection for the 13th of #Drinktober, so it’s just a boring old pint of Heineken this evening. Might have to go find a proper pub…

item.title: Day 12 - More gin!
item.description: #Drinktober the 12th. Gin and pink grapefruit tonight - it’s really rather nice

item.title: Day 11 - Onwards to Valhalla!
item.description: 11th of #Drinktober and I’ve gone all Viking with a horn of mead \m/

item.title: Day 10 - Tequila time!
item.description: It’s the 10th of #Drinktober and tonight I’m having a margarita

item.title: Day 9 - bubbles!
item.description: Drop of cava for the 9th of #Drinktober - bubbleicious!

item.title: Day 8 - Sunshine!
item.description: 8th of #Drinktober and just for a change the daystar showed its face. Seemed like a good opportunity to take this Malibu & pineapple out in the garden and catch a bit of sun

item.title: Day 7 - This one's for Lemmy
item.description: Jack and coke for the 7th of #Drinktober. This one’s dedicated to Lemmy \m/

item.title: Day 6 - Curry night!
item.description: 6th of #Drinktober, and it’s Curry night! So that means chicken vindaloo and frosty Indian lager :)

item.title: Day 5 - Vodka and coke
item.description: It’s the 5th of #Drinktober, and today I’m having vodka and coke.

item.title: Day 4 - Old Rosie
item.description: Drop of cider for the 4th of #Drinktober - cheers!

item.title: Day 3 - Scurvy
item.description: For the 3rd of #Drinktober, I’ve got a bit of a pirate theme going, with Captain Morgan and coke. Yarr!

item.title: Day 2 - Gin o'Clock
item.description: 2nd of #Drinktober. Gin o’Clock :)

item.title: Day 1 - It begins!
item.description: #Drinktober begins with a nice pint of fine Ruby ale. Mmm, lovely…

PRIVACY NOTICE Last updated September 19, 2020 Thank you for choosing to be part of our community at Drinktober (“Company”, “we”, “us”, “our”). We are committed to protecting your personal information and your right to privacy. If you have any questions or concerns about this privacy notice, or our practices with regards to your personal information, please contact us at drinktober@technicalhat.com. When you visit our website https://drinktober.co.uk/ (the “Website”), and more generally, use any of our services (the “Services”, which include the Website), we appreciate that you are trusting us with your personal information.
